005package edu.wpi.first.networktables;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.util.WPIUtilJNI;
008import edu.wpi.first.util.datalog.DataLog;
009import java.util.HashMap;
010import java.util.Map;
011import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
012import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap;
013import java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock;
014import java.util.function.Consumer;
015
016/**
017 * NetworkTables Instance.
018 *
019 * <p>Instances are completely independent from each other. Table operations on one instance will
020 * not be visible to other instances unless the instances are connected via the network. The main
021 * limitation on instances is that you cannot have two servers on the same network port. The main
022 * utility of instances is for unit testing, but they can also enable one program to connect to two
023 * different NetworkTables networks.
024 *
025 * <p>The global "default" instance (as returned by {@link #getDefault()}) is always available, and
026 * is intended for the common case when there is only a single NetworkTables instance being used in
027 * the program.
028 *
029 * <p>Additional instances can be created with the {@link #create()} function. A reference must be
030 * kept to the NetworkTableInstance returned by this function to keep it from being garbage
031 * collected.
032 */
033public final class NetworkTableInstance implements AutoCloseable {
034  /**
035   * Client/server mode flag values (as returned by {@link #getNetworkMode()}). This is a bitmask.
036   */
037  public static final int kNetModeNone = 0x00;
038
039  public static final int kNetModeServer = 0x01;
040  public static final int kNetModeClient3 = 0x02;
041  public static final int kNetModeClient4 = 0x04;
042  public static final int kNetModeStarting = 0x08;
043  public static final int kNetModeLocal = 0x10;
044
045  /** The default port that network tables operates on for NT3. */
046  public static final int kDefaultPort3 = 1735;
047
048  /** The default port that network tables operates on for NT4. */
049  public static final int kDefaultPort4 = 5810;
050
051  /**
052   * Construct from native handle.
053   *
054   * @param handle Native handle
055   */
056  private NetworkTableInstance(int handle) {
057    m_owned = false;
058    m_handle = handle;
059  }
060
061  /** Destroys the instance (if created by {@link #create()}). */
062  @Override
063  public synchronized void close() {
064    if (m_owned && m_handle != 0) {
065      NetworkTablesJNI.destroyInstance(m_handle);
066    }
067  }
068
069  /**
070   * Determines if the native handle is valid.
071   *
072   * @return True if the native handle is valid, false otherwise.
073   */
074  public boolean isValid() {
075    return m_handle != 0;
076  }
077
078  /* The default instance. */
079  private static NetworkTableInstance s_defaultInstance;
080
081  /**
082   * Get global default instance.
083   *
084   * @return Global default instance
085   */
086  public static synchronized NetworkTableInstance getDefault() {
087    if (s_defaultInstance == null) {
088      s_defaultInstance = new NetworkTableInstance(NetworkTablesJNI.getDefaultInstance());
089    }
090    return s_defaultInstance;
091  }
092
093  /**
094   * Create an instance. Note: A reference to the returned instance must be retained to ensure the
095   * instance is not garbage collected.
096   *
097   * @return Newly created instance
098   */
099  public static NetworkTableInstance create() {
100    NetworkTableInstance inst = new NetworkTableInstance(NetworkTablesJNI.createInstance());
101    inst.m_owned = true;
102    return inst;
103  }
104
105  /**
106   * Gets the native handle for the instance.
107   *
108   * @return Native handle
109   */
110  public int getHandle() {
111    return m_handle;
112  }
113
114  /**
115   * Get (generic) topic.
116   *
117   * @param name topic name
118   * @return Topic
119   */
120  public Topic getTopic(String name) {
121    Topic topic = m_topics.get(name);
122    if (topic == null) {
123      int handle = NetworkTablesJNI.getTopic(m_handle, name);
124      topic = new Topic(this, handle);
125      Topic oldTopic = m_topics.putIfAbsent(name, topic);
126      if (oldTopic != null) {
127        topic = oldTopic;
128      }
129      // also cache by handle
130      m_topicsByHandle.putIfAbsent(handle, topic);
131    }
132    return topic;
133  }
134
135  /**
136   * Get boolean topic.
137   *
138   * @param name topic name
139   * @return BooleanTopic
140   */
141  public BooleanTopic getBooleanTopic(String name) {
142    Topic topic = m_topics.get(name);
143    if (topic instanceof BooleanTopic) {
144      return (BooleanTopic) topic;
145    }
146
147    int handle;
148    if (topic == null) {
149      handle = NetworkTablesJNI.getTopic(m_handle, name);
150    } else {
151      handle = topic.getHandle();
152    }
153
154    topic = new BooleanTopic(this, handle);
155    m_topics.put(name, topic);
156
157    // also cache by handle
158    m_topicsByHandle.put(handle, topic);
159
160    return (BooleanTopic) topic;
161  }
162
163  /**
164   * Get long topic.
165   *
166   * @param name topic name
167   * @return IntegerTopic
168   */
169  public IntegerTopic getIntegerTopic(String name) {
170    Topic topic = m_topics.get(name);
171    if (topic instanceof IntegerTopic) {
172      return (IntegerTopic) topic;
173    }
174
175    int handle;
176    if (topic == null) {
177      handle = NetworkTablesJNI.getTopic(m_handle, name);
178    } else {
179      handle = topic.getHandle();
180    }
181
182    topic = new IntegerTopic(this, handle);
183    m_topics.put(name, topic);
184
185    // also cache by handle
186    m_topicsByHandle.put(handle, topic);
187
188    return (IntegerTopic) topic;
189  }
190

441  }
442
443  private Topic[] topicHandlesToTopics(int[] handles) {
444    Topic[] topics = new Topic[handles.length];
445    for (int i = 0; i < handles.length; i++) {
446      topics[i] = getCachedTopic(handles[i]);
447    }
448    return topics;
449  }
450
451  /**
452   * Get all published topics.
453   *
454   * @return Array of topics.
455   */
456  public Topic[] getTopics() {
457    return topicHandlesToTopics(NetworkTablesJNI.getTopics(m_handle, "", 0));
458  }
459
460  /**
461   * Get published topics starting with the given prefix. The results are optionally filtered by
462   * string prefix to only return a subset of all topics.
463   *
464   * @param prefix topic name required prefix; only topics whose name starts with this string are
465   *     returned
466   * @return Array of topic information.
467   */
468  public Topic[] getTopics(String prefix) {
469    return topicHandlesToTopics(NetworkTablesJNI.getTopics(m_handle, prefix, 0));
470  }
471
472  /**
473   * Get published topics starting with the given prefix. The results are optionally filtered by
474   * string prefix and data type to only return a subset of all topics.
475   *
476   * @param prefix topic name required prefix; only topics whose name starts with this string are
477   *     returned
478   * @param types bitmask of data types; 0 is treated as a "don't care"
479   * @return Array of topic information.
480   */
481  public Topic[] getTopics(String prefix, int types) {
482    return topicHandlesToTopics(NetworkTablesJNI.getTopics(m_handle, prefix, types));
483  }
484
485  /**
486   * Get published topics starting with the given prefix. The results are optionally filtered by
487   * string prefix and data type to only return a subset of all topics.
488   *
489   * @param prefix topic name required prefix; only topics whose name starts with this string are
490   *     returned
491   * @param types array of data type strings
492   * @return Array of topic information.
493   */
494  public Topic[] getTopics(String prefix, String[] types) {
495    return topicHandlesToTopics(NetworkTablesJNI.getTopicsStr(m_handle, prefix, types));
496  }
497

533   * Get information about topics starting with the given prefix. The results are optionally

539   * @return Array of topic information.

543  }
544
545  /* Cache of created entries. */
546  private final ConcurrentMap<String, NetworkTableEntry> m_entries = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
547
548  /**
549   * Gets the entry for a key.
550   *
551   * @param name Key
552   * @return Network table entry.
553   */
554  public NetworkTableEntry getEntry(String name) {
555    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_entries.get(name);
556    if (entry == null) {
557      entry = new NetworkTableEntry(this, NetworkTablesJNI.getEntry(m_handle, name));
558      NetworkTableEntry oldEntry = m_entries.putIfAbsent(name, entry);
559      if (oldEntry != null) {
560        entry = oldEntry;
561      }
562    }
563    return entry;
564  }
565
566  /* Cache of created topics. */
567  private final ConcurrentMap<String, Topic> m_topics = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
568  private final ConcurrentMap<Integer, Topic> m_topicsByHandle = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
569
570  Topic getCachedTopic(String name) {
571    Topic topic = m_topics.get(name);
572    if (topic == null) {
573      int handle = NetworkTablesJNI.getTopic(m_handle, name);
574      topic = new Topic(this, handle);
575      Topic oldTopic = m_topics.putIfAbsent(name, topic);
576      if (oldTopic != null) {
577        topic = oldTopic;
578      }
579      // also cache by handle
580      m_topicsByHandle.putIfAbsent(handle, topic);
581    }
582    return topic;
583  }
584
585  Topic getCachedTopic(int handle) {
586    Topic topic = m_topicsByHandle.get(handle);
587    if (topic == null) {
588      topic = new Topic(this, handle);
589      Topic oldTopic = m_topicsByHandle.putIfAbsent(handle, topic);
590      if (oldTopic != null) {
591        topic = oldTopic;
592      }
593    }
594    return topic;
595  }
596
597  /* Cache of created tables. */
598  private final ConcurrentMap<String, NetworkTable> m_tables = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
599
600  /**
601   * Gets the table with the specified key.
602   *
603   * @param key the key name
604   * @return The network table
605   */
606  public NetworkTable getTable(String key) {
607    // prepend leading / if not present
608    String theKey;
609    if (key.isEmpty() || "/".equals(key)) {
610      theKey = "";
611    } else if (key.charAt(0) == NetworkTable.PATH_SEPARATOR) {
612      theKey = key;
613    } else {
614      theKey = NetworkTable.PATH_SEPARATOR + key;
615    }
616
617    // cache created tables
618    NetworkTable table = m_tables.get(theKey);
619    if (table == null) {
620      table = new NetworkTable(this, theKey);
621      NetworkTable oldTable = m_tables.putIfAbsent(theKey, table);
622      if (oldTable != null) {
623        table = oldTable;
624      }
625    }
626    return table;
627  }
628
629  /*
630   * Callback Creation Functions
631   */
632
633  private final ReentrantLock m_connectionListenerLock = new ReentrantLock();
634  private final Map<Integer, Consumer<ConnectionNotification>> m_connectionListeners =
635      new HashMap<>();
636  private int m_connectionListenerPoller;
637
638  @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidCatchingThrowable")
639  private void startConnectionListenerThread() {
640    var connectionListenerThread =
641        new Thread(
642            () -> {
643              boolean wasInterrupted = false;
644              while (!Thread.interrupted()) {
645                try {
646                  WPIUtilJNI.waitForObject(m_connectionListenerPoller);
647                } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
648                  Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
649                  // don't try to destroy poller, as its handle is likely no longer valid
650                  wasInterrupted = true;
651                  break;
652                }
653                ConnectionNotification[] events =
654                  NetworkTablesJNI.readConnectionListenerQueue(this, m_connectionListenerPoller);
655                for (ConnectionNotification event : events) {
656                  Consumer<ConnectionNotification> listener;
657                  m_connectionListenerLock.lock();
658                  try {
659                    listener = m_connectionListeners.get(event.listener);
660                  } finally {
661                    m_connectionListenerLock.unlock();
662                  }
663                  if (listener != null) {
664                    try {
665                      listener.accept(event);
666                    } catch (Throwable throwable) {
667                      System.err.println(
668                          "Unhandled exception during connection listener callback: "
669                              + throwable.toString());
670                      throwable.printStackTrace();
671                    }
672                  }
673                }
674              }
675              m_connectionListenerLock.lock();
676              try {
677                if (!wasInterrupted) {
678                  NetworkTablesJNI.destroyConnectionListenerPoller(m_connectionListenerPoller);
679                }
680                m_connectionListenerPoller = 0;
681              } finally {
682                m_connectionListenerLock.unlock();
683              }
684            },
685            "NTConnectionListener");
686    connectionListenerThread.setDaemon(true);
687    connectionListenerThread.start();
688  }
689
690  /**
691   * Add a connection listener.
692   *
693   * @param listener Listener to add
694   * @param immediateNotify Notify listener of all existing connections
695   * @return Listener handle
696   */
697  public int addConnectionListener(
698      Consumer<ConnectionNotification> listener, boolean immediateNotify) {
699    m_connectionListenerLock.lock();
700    try {
701      if (m_connectionListenerPoller == 0) {
702        m_connectionListenerPoller = NetworkTablesJNI.createConnectionListenerPoller(m_handle);
703        startConnectionListenerThread();
704      }
705      int handle =
706          NetworkTablesJNI.addPolledConnectionListener(m_connectionListenerPoller, immediateNotify);
707      m_connectionListeners.put(handle, listener);
708      return handle;
709    } finally {
710      m_connectionListenerLock.unlock();
711    }
712  }
713
714  /**
715   * Remove a connection listener.
716   *
717   * @param listener Listener handle to remove
718   */
719  public void removeConnectionListener(int listener) {
720    m_connectionListenerLock.lock();
721    try {
722      m_connectionListeners.remove(listener);
723    } finally {
724      m_connectionListenerLock.unlock();
725    }
726    NetworkTablesJNI.removeConnectionListener(listener);
727  }
728
729  /*
730   * Client/Server Functions
731   */
732
733  /**
734   * Get the current network mode.
735   *
736   * @return Bitmask of NetworkMode.
737   */
738  public int getNetworkMode() {
739    return NetworkTablesJNI.getNetworkMode(m_handle);
740  }
741
742  /**
743   * Starts local-only operation. Prevents calls to startServer or startClient from taking effect.
744   * Has no effect if startServer or startClient has already been called.
745   */
746  public void startLocal() {
747    NetworkTablesJNI.startLocal(m_handle);
748  }
749
750  /**
751   * Stops local-only operation. startServer or startClient can be called after this call to start a
752   * server or client.
753   */
754  public void stopLocal() {
755    NetworkTablesJNI.stopLocal(m_handle);
756  }
757
758  /**
759   * Starts a server using the networktables.json as the persistent file, using the default
760   * listening address and port.
761   */
762  public void startServer() {
763    startServer("networktables.json");
764  }
765
766  /**
767   * Starts a server using the specified persistent filename, using the default listening address
768   * and port.
769   *
770   * @param persistFilename the name of the persist file to use
771   */
772  public void startServer(String persistFilename) {
773    startServer(persistFilename, "");
774  }
775
776  /**
777   * Starts a server using the specified filename and listening address, using the default port.
778   *
779   * @param persistFilename the name of the persist file to use
780   * @param listenAddress the address to listen on, or empty to listen on any address
781   */
782  public void startServer(String persistFilename, String listenAddress) {
783    startServer(persistFilename, listenAddress, kDefaultPort3, kDefaultPort4);
784  }
785
786  /**
787   * Starts a server using the specified filename, listening address, and port.
788   *
789   * @param persistFilename the name of the persist file to use
790   * @param listenAddress the address to listen on, or empty to listen on any address
791   * @param port3 port to communicate over (NT3)
792   */
793  public void startServer(String persistFilename, String listenAddress, int port3) {
794    startServer(persistFilename, listenAddress, port3, kDefaultPort4);
795  }
796
797  /**
798   * Starts a server using the specified filename, listening address, and port.
799   *
800   * @param persistFilename the name of the persist file to use
801   * @param listenAddress the address to listen on, or empty to listen on any address
802   * @param port3 port to communicate over (NT3)
803   * @param port4 port to communicate over (NT4)
804   */
805  public void startServer(String persistFilename, String listenAddress, int port3, int port4) {
806    NetworkTablesJNI.startServer(m_handle, persistFilename, listenAddress, port3, port4);
807  }
808
809  /** Stops the server if it is running. */
810  public void stopServer() {
811    NetworkTablesJNI.stopServer(m_handle);
812  }
813
814  /**
815   * Starts a NT3 client. Use SetServer or SetServerTeam to set the server name and port.
816   *
817   * @param identity network identity to advertise (cannot be empty string)
818   */
819  public void startClient3(String identity) {
820    NetworkTablesJNI.startClient3(m_handle, identity);
821  }
822
823  /**
824   * Starts a NT4 client. Use SetServer or SetServerTeam to set the server name and port.
825   *
826   * @param identity network identity to advertise (cannot be empty string)
827   */
828  public void startClient4(String identity) {
829    NetworkTablesJNI.startClient4(m_handle, identity);
830  }
831
832  /** Stops the client if it is running. */
833  public void stopClient() {
834    NetworkTablesJNI.stopClient(m_handle);
835  }
836
837  /**
838   * Sets server address and port for client (without restarting client). Changes the port to the
839   * default port.
840   *
841   * @param serverName server name
842   */
843  public void setServer(String serverName) {
844    setServer(serverName, 0);
845  }
846
847  /**
848   * Sets server address and port for client (without restarting client).
849   *
850   * @param serverName server name
851   * @param port port to communicate over (0=default)
852   */
853  public void setServer(String serverName, int port) {
854    NetworkTablesJNI.setServer(m_handle, serverName, port);
855  }
856
857  /**
858   * Sets server addresses and port for client (without restarting client). Changes the port to the
859   * default port. The client will attempt to connect to each server in round robin fashion.
860   *
861   * @param serverNames array of server names
862   */
863  public void setServer(String[] serverNames) {
864    setServer(serverNames, 0);
865  }
866
867  /**
868   * Sets server addresses and port for client (without restarting client). The client will attempt
869   * to connect to each server in round robin fashion.
870   *
871   * @param serverNames array of server names
872   * @param port port to communicate over (0=default)
873   */
874  public void setServer(String[] serverNames, int port) {
875    int[] ports = new int[serverNames.length];
876    for (int i = 0; i < serverNames.length; i++) {
877      ports[i] = port;
878    }
879    setServer(serverNames, ports);
880  }
881
882  /**
883   * Sets server addresses and ports for client (without restarting client). The client will attempt
884   * to connect to each server in round robin fashion.
885   *
886   * @param serverNames array of server names
887   * @param ports array of port numbers (0=default)
888   */
889  public void setServer(String[] serverNames, int[] ports) {
890    NetworkTablesJNI.setServer(m_handle, serverNames, ports);
891  }
892
893  /**
894   * Sets server addresses and port for client (without restarting client). Changes the port to the
895   * default port. The client will attempt to connect to each server in round robin fashion.
896   *
897   * @param team team number
898   */
899  public void setServerTeam(int team) {
900    setServerTeam(team, 0);
901  }
902
903  /**
904   * Sets server addresses and port for client (without restarting client). Connects using commonly
905   * known robot addresses for the specified team.
906   *
907   * @param team team number
908   * @param port port to communicate over (0=default)
909   */
910  public void setServerTeam(int team, int port) {
911    NetworkTablesJNI.setServerTeam(m_handle, team, port);
912  }
913
914  /**
915   * Starts requesting server address from Driver Station. This connects to the Driver Station
916   * running on localhost to obtain the server IP address, and connects with the default port.
917   */
918  public void startDSClient() {
919    startDSClient(0);
920  }
921
922  /**
923   * Starts requesting server address from Driver Station. This connects to the Driver Station
924   * running on localhost to obtain the server IP address.
925   *
926   * @param port server port to use in combination with IP from DS (0=default)
927   */
928  public void startDSClient(int port) {
929    NetworkTablesJNI.startDSClient(m_handle, port);
930  }
931
932  /** Stops requesting server address from Driver Station. */
933  public void stopDSClient() {
934    NetworkTablesJNI.stopDSClient(m_handle);
935  }
936
937  /**
938   * Flushes all updated values immediately to the local client/server. This does not flush to the
939   * network.
940   */
941  public void flushLocal() {
942    NetworkTablesJNI.flushLocal(m_handle);
943  }
944
945  /**
946   * Flushes all updated values immediately to the network. Note: This is rate-limited to protect
947   * the network from flooding. This is primarily useful for synchronizing network updates with user
948   * code.
949   */
950  public void flush() {
951    NetworkTablesJNI.flush(m_handle);
952  }
953
954  /**
955   * Gets information on the currently established network connections. If operating as a client,
956   * this will return either zero or one values.
957   *
958   * @return array of connection information
959   */
960  public ConnectionInfo[] getConnections() {
961    return NetworkTablesJNI.getConnections(m_handle);
962  }
963
964  /**
965   * Return whether or not the instance is connected to another node.
966   *
967   * @return True if connected.
968   */
969  public boolean isConnected() {
970    return NetworkTablesJNI.isConnected(m_handle);
971  }
972
973  /**
974   * Starts logging entry changes to a DataLog.
975   *
976   * @param log data log object; lifetime must extend until StopEntryDataLog is called or the
977   *     instance is destroyed
978   * @param prefix only store entries with names that start with this prefix; the prefix is not
979   *     included in the data log entry name
980   * @param logPrefix prefix to add to data log entry names
981   * @return Data logger handle
982   */
983  public int startEntryDataLog(DataLog log, String prefix, String logPrefix) {
984    return NetworkTablesJNI.startEntryDataLog(m_handle, log, prefix, logPrefix);
985  }
986
987  /**
988   * Stops logging entry changes to a DataLog.
989   *
990   * @param logger data logger handle
991   */
992  public static void stopEntryDataLog(int logger) {
993    NetworkTablesJNI.stopEntryDataLog(logger);
994  }
995
996  /**
997   * Starts logging connection changes to a DataLog.
998   *
999   * @param log data log object; lifetime must extend until StopConnectionDataLog is called or the
1000   *     instance is destroyed
1001   * @param name data log entry name
1002   * @return Data logger handle
1003   */
1004  public int startConnectionDataLog(DataLog log, String name) {
1005    return NetworkTablesJNI.startConnectionDataLog(m_handle, log, name);
1006  }
1007
1008  /**
1009   * Stops logging connection changes to a DataLog.
1010   *
1011   * @param logger data logger handle
1012   */
1013  public static void stopConnectionDataLog(int logger) {
1014    NetworkTablesJNI.stopConnectionDataLog(logger);
1015  }
1016
1017  private final ReentrantLock m_loggerLock = new ReentrantLock();
1018  private final Map<Integer, Consumer<LogMessage>> m_loggers = new HashMap<>();
1019  private int m_loggerPoller;
1020
1021  @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidCatchingThrowable")
1022  private void startLogThread() {
1023    var loggerThread =
1024        new Thread(
1025            () -> {
1026              boolean wasInterrupted = false;
1027              while (!Thread.interrupted()) {
1028                try {
1029                  WPIUtilJNI.waitForObject(m_loggerPoller);
1030                } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
1031                  Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
1032                  // don't try to destroy poller, as its handle is likely no longer valid
1033                  wasInterrupted = true;
1034                  break;
1035                }
1036                LogMessage[] events = NetworkTablesJNI.readLoggerQueue(this, m_loggerPoller);
1037                for (LogMessage event : events) {
1038                  Consumer<LogMessage> logger;
1039                  m_loggerLock.lock();
1040                  try {
1041                    logger = m_loggers.get(event.logger);
1042                  } finally {
1043                    m_loggerLock.unlock();
1044                  }
1045                  if (logger != null) {
1046                    try {
1047                      logger.accept(event);
1048                    } catch (Throwable throwable) {
1049                      System.err.println(
1050                          "Unhandled exception during logger callback: " + throwable.toString());
1051                      throwable.printStackTrace();
1052                    }
1053                  }
1054                }
1055              }
1056              m_loggerLock.lock();
1057              try {
1058                if (!wasInterrupted) {
1059                  NetworkTablesJNI.destroyLoggerPoller(m_loggerPoller);
1060                }
1061              } finally {
1062                m_loggerLock.unlock();
1063              }
1064            },
1065            "NTLogger");
1066    loggerThread.setDaemon(true);
1067    loggerThread.start();
1068  }
1069
1070  /**
1071   * Add logger callback function. By default, log messages are sent to stderr; this function sends
1072   * log messages with the specified levels to the provided callback function instead. The callback
1073   * function will only be called for log messages with level greater than or equal to minLevel and
1074   * less than or equal to maxLevel; messages outside this range will be silently ignored.
1075   *
1076   * @param func log callback function
1077   * @param minLevel minimum log level
1078   * @param maxLevel maximum log level
1079   * @return Logger handle
1080   */
1081  public int addLogger(Consumer<LogMessage> func, int minLevel, int maxLevel) {
1082    m_loggerLock.lock();
1083    try {
1084      if (m_loggerPoller == 0) {
1085        m_loggerPoller = NetworkTablesJNI.createLoggerPoller(m_handle);
1086        startLogThread();
1087      }
1088      int handle = NetworkTablesJNI.addPolledLogger(m_loggerPoller, minLevel, maxLevel);
1089      m_loggers.put(handle, func);
1090      return handle;
1091    } finally {
1092      m_loggerLock.unlock();
1093    }
1094  }
1095
1096  /**
1097   * Remove a logger.
1098   *
1099   * @param logger Logger handle to remove
1100   */
1101  public void removeLogger(int logger) {
1102    m_loggerLock.lock();
1103    try {
1104      m_loggers.remove(logger);
1105    } finally {
1106      m_loggerLock.unlock();
1107    }
1108    NetworkTablesJNI.removeLogger(logger);
1109  }
1110
1111  @Override
1112  public boolean equals(Object other) {
1113    if (other == this) {
1114      return true;
1115    }
1116    if (!(other instanceof NetworkTableInstance)) {
1117      return false;
1118    }
1119
1120    return m_handle == ((NetworkTableInstance) other).m_handle;
1121  }
1122
1123  @Override
1124  public int hashCode() {
1125    return m_handle;
1126  }
1127
1128  private boolean m_owned;
1129  private final int m_handle;
1130}
